references.reason: This paper is foundational for the field of large language models, introducing the concept of few-shot learning and demonstrating the capabilities of large language models in various tasks.

references.paper_title: Pythia: A suite for analyzing large language models across training and scaling
references.reason: The Pythia model suite, introduced in this paper, serves as the basis for the experiments in the target paper, providing a standardized benchmark for comparing different data selection methods.

references.paper_title: MIMIC-III, a freely accessible critical care database
references.reason: The MIMIC-III dataset is used as one of the primary datasets in the paper, providing a comprehensive collection of clinical data for evaluating the effectiveness of the data selection method in the clinical text summarization task.

references.paper_title: Training verifiers to solve math word problems
references.reason: This paper introduces the GSM8K dataset, used as one of the evaluation datasets in the target paper, providing a collection of mathematical problem-solving examples.

references.paper_title: Measuring mathematical problem solving with the MATH dataset
references.reason: The MATH dataset is another key evaluation dataset in the target paper, offering a challenging benchmark for assessing the performance of LLMs in mathematical reasoning.
